lines.text:
[admonishing Kassandra after stopping her crashing the car]
Let your attention lie before you, not beside you.
Check this! Some guy from the seventeenth century telling ME how to drive. How quick they learn!

[pointing to Giles' weathervane]
Can I take that for you?
Over my rotting corpse!
[the Channeler is faking the channeling of a spirit for the Warlock]
I have come - Zamiel. Ask... me... what... you... will.
I would ask that we wait.
For... what... do... we... wait?
For the true Zamiel to appear.
a decade twice over a day.
So, you fear me.
'Tis I who others fear.
Not you, the magic.

[Having been told the Warlock's true goal]
He scares the crap out of me... and he KNOWS it.
I'll not let him harm you.
Next time there won't be any spells, no hexes, no potions. Next time, he's gonna kill me.
I'll not let him harm you.
[He holds out Kassandra's car keys]
And we are bewitched!

[upon finding herself cursed with sudden aging]
Twenty fuckin' years and not one party. What a total ass burr!

[sternly]
Lest you favor throttlings to the ears and face, bear west here.

[to himself]
They wonder why we hate the Lakers.
[upon meeting Redferne in the present day]
Of all the curiosities here I've seen, none have surprised me more than this.
Let's tarry not!
You tellin' me you're a witch? You ain't no witch! Witches are girls!
Some are men.
Yeah? So where's your broomstick?
You hail spirits, do you not?
Yes... I channel them. Were you, uh, at the session?
Then channel me a spirit.

[to a wounded man]
Meddle not with the dressing.

[watching the Warlock play a handheld football game]
Hey, you can't punt on first down. Nobody does that, not even Tampa Bay!
[Kassandra has aged 20 years in a day after being cursed by the Warlock]
Why couldn't he just kill me? Nothing could be worse than this!
His very thought.
Can I ask what your interest is in finding such a book?

Our interest lies in stopping those who would see all good falter. It lies in stopping the powers of misrule from coming of age. It lies in finding that damned book, and thwarting a vile beast of a man who shall not rest until God himself is thrown down, and all of creation becomes Satan's black hell-besmeared farting hole!
You asked.
How comes it that you have brought me here?

[possessed by Zamiel]
Bring together that which has been thirded. Bring together my bible.
The Grand Grimoire, here? Now?
Now, brute, one last time will we play the game out.
...Let me give you some advice - get away from this house.
You got a watch?
Yeah.
Time me.

[to Giles]
Not a local product, are ya?
The alter table, he broked it?
Yeah, he "broked" it.
Of all ingredients used by a witch, the most coveted is human fat. If that fat is cut from an unbaptized male child, there is but one purpose - one thing is will beget.
I'm listening.
Flying potion.

The spell book. All witches keep grimoires, yet one is indestructible, one is the bible of black magic - the Grand Grimoire. Always witches have lusted for it, and now, here, I find a page - one lone page!
The hammer! Take it! Where you find his tracks, nail the earth deeply!
The warlock holds two parts of the book. This much he confessed. Know you what happens should he gain all three?
I don't want to know. I don't.
Hidden within that book is the name of God, the lost name of God.
The lost name of... Huh-uh, I don't wanna hear this.
'Tis the name invoked during creation. Witches charge that should this name, this true name of God, be uttered back to front...
I'm not listening.
Should this name be uttered in reverse...

[fingers in ears]
Blah, blah, bah, blah, blah!
...all creation will undo. 'Twill reverse.
My boots work best with ground beneath them - DIRECTLY beneath.

[bursting into the farmhouse]
Tell me your woes! You are bewitched!
